page.title: 12Friston Forest Nature Trail
page.content: On a warm damp July morning we set out to survey our allotted part of Friston Forest;we parked in one of the car parks of the Forestry Commision. Our path led us to a ridge overlooking Charleston Bottom-a sharp contrast between agricultural fields on the one hand and forest on the other.Despite the fact that it was July and holiday time,we saw only one other walker;it seems few people venture far from their cars,except long distance walkers using the South Downs Way, which crosses the forest.We met a Parisian family who had been touring Great Britain during the previous fortnight;they had parked their dormobile overnight in the carpark to enjoy the peace and quiet of the forest.We explained,in French,what we were doing,and they told us,in English a little about themselves.
